title: Extended nonnegative integers
content: The function values of the hash (set size) function are either nonnegative integers or positive infinity, see ~ hashf . To avoid the need to distinguish between finite and infinite sets (and therefore if the set size is a nonnegative integer or positive infinity), it is useful to provide a definition of the set of nonnegative integers extended by positive infinity, analogously to the extension of the real numbers ` RR* ` , see ~ df-xr . The definition of extended nonnegative integers can be used in Ramsey theory, because the Ramsey number is either a nonnegative integer or plus infinity, see ~ ramcl2 , or for the degree of polynomials, see ~ mdegcl , or for the degree of vertices in graph theory, see ~ vtxdgf .

blocks.name: cxnn0
blocks.content: The set of extended nonnegative integers.

blocks.name: df-xnn0
blocks.content: Define the set of extended nonnegative integers that includes positive infinity. Analogue of the extension of the real numbers ` RR* ` , see ~ df-xr . (Contributed by AV, 10-Dec-2020.)

blocks.name: elxnn0
blocks.content: An extended nonnegative integer is either a standard nonnegative integer or positive infinity. (Contributed by AV, 10-Dec-2020.)

blocks.name: nn0ssxnn0
blocks.content: The standard nonnegative integers are a subset of the extended nonnegative integers. (Contributed by AV, 10-Dec-2020.)

blocks.name: nn0xnn0
blocks.content: A standard nonnegative integer is an extended nonnegative integer. (Contributed by AV, 10-Dec-2020.)

blocks.name: xnn0xr
blocks.content: An extended nonnegative integer is an extended real. (Contributed by AV, 10-Dec-2020.)

blocks.name: 0xnn0
blocks.content: Zero is an extended nonnegative integer. (Contributed by AV, 10-Dec-2020.)

blocks.name: pnf0xnn0
blocks.content: Positive infinity is an extended nonnegative integer. (Contributed by AV, 10-Dec-2020.)

blocks.name: nn0nepnf
blocks.content: No standard nonnegative integer equals positive infinity. (Contributed by AV, 10-Dec-2020.)

blocks.name: nn0xnn0d
blocks.content: A standard nonnegative integer is an extended nonnegative integer, deduction form. (Contributed by AV, 10-Dec-2020.)

blocks.name: nn0nepnfd
blocks.content: No standard nonnegative integer equals positive infinity, deduction form. (Contributed by AV, 10-Dec-2020.)

blocks.name: xnn0nemnf
blocks.content: No extended nonnegative integer equals negative infinity. (Contributed by AV, 10-Dec-2020.)

blocks.name: xnn0xrnemnf
blocks.content: The extended nonnegative integers are extended reals without negative infinity. (Contributed by AV, 10-Dec-2020.)

blocks.name: xnn0nnn0pnf
blocks.content: An extended nonnegative integer which is not a standard nonnegative integer is positive infinity. (Contributed by AV, 10-Dec-2020.)
